intro: Brachystelma keniense, commonly known as the Kenyan stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. Brachystelma keniense produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, often blooming during the rainy season.
